intro: Pluchea floribunda, commonly known as the golden cupplant, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small yellow cups. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and branching. The flowers bloom in clusters, producing a distinctive yellow color that attracts pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
